Job Title: Senior Remediation Engineer

Location: New York, United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Consulting, Engineering, Project Management

Description:
Founded in 1981, AKRF is an award-winning consulting firm with 300 professionals bringing the value of strategic thinking to our land development, transportation, energy, and water clients. We serve our clients through a commitment to technical excellence across our portfolio of professional services, while always acting with integrity and fostering a culture of innovation, collaboration, and environmental stewardship. Offices are located throughout New York, New Jersey, Pennsylvania, Maryland, Virginia, and Connecticut, and the company completes projects around the country. 
Professionals join and remain at AKRF for our corporate-casual environment that values flexible work schedules and locations, and balances award-winning planning, engineering, and environmental projects with social impact initiatives, charitable giving, and plenty of fun and games. Our firm fosters a diverse, equitable, and inclusive environment where employees are respected and valued in honor of their identities; we strive to deliver on this promise every day.
The SAR Department at AKRF is seeking a Senior Remediation Engineer to work in New York City, White Plains, Philadelphia, or NJ office.  
Job Responsibilities:
Prepare remedial alternative analyses/feasibility studies.Prepare bid/construction documents and lead remedial procurement process with equipment vendors and contractors.Perform construction inspections and system start-up, implement system operation, maintenance, and monitoring (OM&M) plans.Assume project leadership responsibility for environmental remediation projects, including planning, scheduling, and coordination.Undertake technical work in accordance with the contracted scope of work, budget, schedule and legislative standards.Perform field work including (but not limited to) contractor oversight, and soil, surface water, groundwater and soil vapor sampling.Coordinate and prepare written reports, work plans, and technical memorandums; analyze data and develop supported conclusions; and assist with design of remedial technologies.Work collaboratively with other teams within the SAR department, and professionals across internal business lines.Proactively identify opportunities to increase project efficiencies, improve technical methodologies and add value to client service offeringsAssist with training and development of junior staff through mentoring.
Essential Requirements: 
Bachelor's and/or master’s degree in engineering.Minimum 8 years of experience in environmental remediation system design.OSHA 40-hour HAZWOPER Certification.Must be proficient in CAD. Experience in Revit is a plus.Must have strong writing and communication skills and decision-making abilities.Knowledge and understanding of New York City building/mechanical/plumbing code and NYSDEC/NYCOER/NYCDEP regulations is a plus.P.E. license is preferred, but not required.
Compensation will range from $100K-$150K, dependent upon experience and roles and responsibilities. 
AKRF, Inc. enforces a policy of equal employment opportunity in our daily operations. The firm has a demonstrated history of hiring, training, developing, promoting and retaining minority group members and women. All employment- related decisions are based solely on relevant criteria and without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, pregnancy, national origin, age, physical or mental disability, marital status, sexual orientation, sexual identity, caregiver status, military/veteran status or citizenship status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level

Undertake technical work in accordance with the contracted scope of work, budget, schedule and legislative standards.
Perform field work including (but not limited to) contractor oversight, and soil, surface water, groundwater and soil vapor sampling.

Work collaboratively with other teams within the SAR department, and professionals across internal business lines.
Proactively identify opportunities to increase project efficiencies, improve technical methodologies and add value to client service offerings.
